Here is a message from Superintendent Brady in regards to the reopening plan:

Today we received notification from the NYS Department of Health that the Massena Central School District as well as several others in our region and 107 in total from New York State had not submitted their reopening plans on or before the deadline of July 31. The District did submit reopening plans by the 7/31 deadline to both the NYSED and NYSDOH. We received an e-mail notification that day that the plan was submitted to the NYSED. I know that many schools were having trouble navigating their link that day and had received an error message. However, after a couple of tries, it did appear to go through. I have been in contact with the NYS Department of Health today which indicated that many schools are reporting that they submitted plans by the deadline. They are looking into the problem.

post_text: Students in Mrs. Jaggers’s science class practiced calculating mass, volume, and density using a triple beam balance, a metric ruler, and the density formula (D=M/V). After getting a basic understanding of those 3 physical properties of matter, they calculated the density of specific liquids and made predictions about which liquids were most dense and least dense. Then they used 10 different liquids to create "density columns" which allowed them to see that denser liquids sink while the least dense liquids float.
